author: Amarnath Tewary
text:
Pappu Yadav has said there is nothing wrong in burning the national flag and raising slogans against India in J&K.

The statement of Jan Adhikar Party leader and Madhepura MP Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav that there is nothing wrong in burning the national flag and raising slogans against India in Jammu and Kashmir has sparked a controversy.

Leaders of the ruling Janata Dal (United) and Rashtriya Janata Dal have termed it “provocative and unwarranted.”

“There is nothing wrong if the people of Kashmir burn Indian flags and raise anti-India slogans… The Constitution says speaking against India is not anti-national…,” Mr. Yadav said, talking to journalists at Saharsha, on Monday. He also said: “All saints are anti-nationals and people should shoo them away from wherever they could be found.”

“The poor should not go to temples, but should be sent to schools... Religious rituals are gimmicks which should be thrown out into the Ganga,” he said.

“Such words from a leader like Pappu Yadav are unwarranted. People of the State know his stature,” senior Janata Dal (United) leader Shyam Rajak said.

Rashtriya Janata Dal leaders said that since he was politically isolated, he was making controversial statements to stay relevant.
title: Pappu Yadav’s statement on national flag sparks a row
